content:
In the story I made about Pyrrhos, he was a wise and just leader who tried to protect his people and the animals in his care. He did not choose evil or harm others, but rather acted with compassion and foresight in the face of disaster.

In the context of a final battle like Armageddon, it's difficult to say how Pyrrhos would align himself without knowing more about the specific beliefs and values of his world. However, based on the character I described in my previous story, it seems likely that he would strive to uphold what he sees as good and just, rather than siding with evil.
